p: The category with most use-reports was that of plants used to treat jaundice, which also had the highest degree of consensus among the healers. Otherwise healthy newborns in Thailand have a high risk of having jaundice [ 63]. In India, 82 species have medicinal folklore reports, are commonly used in traditional systems as antimicrobials and are supposedly effective in the treatment of jaundice. In Thailand, some Thai medicinal plants, such as the liquorice Glycyrrhiza glabra (L.) (Leguminosae) can reduce bilirubin, which is the cause of jaundice symptoms by glycyrrhizin and glycyrrhizic acid [ 64]. Here, we found that healers also used some medicinal plants to treat jaundice including Tinospora crispa (L.) Hook. f. and Thomson (Menispermaceae), Xantonnea parviflora (Kuntze) Craib. (Rubiaceae), and Morinda coreia Buch.-Ham. (Rubiaceae). However, the high IAR values suggest a well-defined selection criterion in the community and/or information exchange between informants [ 65].
